member_organisations:
The Federation has 30 member Societies and 4 associated Societies, representing over 6,000 parasitologists, all over Europe.  
 
 
Each society have to pay a 0.5 € fee for each of its active members per year. The funds should be sent to the Banca Nazionale del Lavoro, Naples, Italy. Most of the EFP funds are used to grant students to attend the EMOPs and to award Young Scientists every 4 years (see www.eurofedpar.eu). 
 
FULL MEMBERS 
ARMENIA : Armenian Society of Parasitologists  
AUSTRIA : Österreichische Gesellschaft für Tropenmedizin,Parasitologie und Migrations medizin  
BELGIUM : Belgian Society of Parasitology and Protistology  
BULGARIA :  Bulgarian Association of Parasitologists  
CZECH REPUBLIC :  Czech Society of Parasitology 
DENMARK :  Danish Society for Parasitology 
FRANCE :  Société Française de Parasitologie  
GEORGIA : Georgian Society of Parasitologists > contact 
GERMANY :  German Society of Parasitology 
HUNGARY : Hungarian Society for Parasitology  
IRELAND :  Irish Society for Parasitology 
ISRAEL :   Israel Society for Parasitology, Protozoology and Tropical Diseases  
ITALY :  Società Italiana di Parassitologia 
THE NETHERLANDS :  Nederlandse Vereeniging voor Parasitologie 
POLAND : Polish Parasitological Society 
ROMANIA : Association of Romanian Parasitologists 
 Fundatia Scientia Parasitologica Pro Vita  RUSSIA :  Parasitological Society at the Russian Academy of Sciences 
RUSSIA : Society of Helminthologists of Russia 
SCANDINAVIA & BALTIC COUNTRIES : Scandinavian-Baltic Society for Parasitology 
SEEPS : Association of South Eastern and Eastern European Parasitologists 
SERBIA: Serbian Society of Parasitologists 
SLOVAK REPUBLIC : Slovak Society for Parasitology 
SPAIN :  Sociedad Espanola de Parasitologia 
SWITZERLAND : Swiss Society of Tropical Medicine and Parasitology 
UNITED KINGDOM : British Society for Parasitology 
UKRAINE : Ukrainian Scientific Society of Parasitologists 
 
 ASSOCIATED MEMBERS 
IRAN : Iranian Society of Parasitology 
ALGERIA : Société Algérienne de Parasitologie-Mycologie Médicale  
EGYPT : Society of Egyptian Parasitologists United 
 
SUSPENDED MEMBERS 
BELORUSSIA : Belorussian Society of Parasitologist 
GREECE : Greek Society of Parasitology 
PAKISTAN : Pakistan Society of Parasitology    
TURKEY : Turkish Society for Parasitology
fields_of_interest: Education and training, Environment, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Research and innovation, Public Health, Food Safety
eu_initiatives:
The main objectives of the European Federation of Parasitologists are : 
- to promote the exchange of knowledge on parasitic organisms and diseases 
- to coordinate researches and networks related to parasitic organisms 
- to support basic, veterinary & medical Parasitology 
- to attract young scientists and students to develop researches in Parasitology 
- to organize a European Multicolloquium of Parasitology (EMOP) every 4 years
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership:
The EFP is member of the World Federation of Parasitologists 
http://www.wfpnet.org/
goals__remit:
The main objectives of the European Federation of Parasitologists are : 
- to promote the exchange of knowledge on parasitic organisms and diseases 
- to coordinate researches and networks related to parasitic organisms 
- to support of basic, veterinary & medical Parasitology 
- to attract young scientists and students to develop researches in Parasitology 
to organize a European Multicolloquium of Parasitology (EMOP) every 4 years
relevant_communication: Organization of  a European Multicolloquium of Parasitology (EMOP) every 4 years gathering about one thousand of participants from Europe and all over the world.
